item.title: Filip: How does life sound?
item.description: Sound and contact with one’s own body Every human being has a musical centre inside, a core from which the rhythm and melody of life emerges.

item.title: Iris, why are we humans sometimes indifferent to very important things?
item.description: Question For some time now I have been struggling with the phenomenon of indifference, where people are indifferent and unaffected by a phenomenon.

item.title: Iris, why are we humans sometimes indifferent to very important things?
item.description: Question For some time now I have been struggling with the phenomenon of indifference, where people are indifferent and unaffected by a phenomenon.

item.title: Iris, why do I get so tired of watching adverts and shopping?
item.description: Question M√§rja gets very tired. She notices that she gets tired when she walks around the city and sees adverts and other things.

item.title: Iris, can you also see the atmosphere via Zoom?
item.description: Question In the introduction you said that you occasionally look at the atmosphere and read.

item.title: Iris, did people have more energy to work in the past?
item.description: Question I have come across this phenomenon of people telling me that they used to be able to work all day and I wonder if it might be related to the third and fourth dimension of communication that this doesn’t really fit together anymore or what could it be related to?

item.title: Iris, what does a person's atmosphere look like?
item.description: Question What does the atmosphere of a human being look like or what is everything in the atmosphere of a human being?

item.title: About
item.description: Hello, I am Alfred Mustermann… As a creative UI/UX designer, I love to create beautiful designs that not only look stunning but also meet the needs of product users.

item.title: Contact
item.description: touches the top of the impenetrable foliage of my trees, and only a few stray glimmers steal into the inner sanctum, I throw myself among the tall grass by the trickling stream, and as I lie close to the earth, a thousand unknown plants are perceived by me.
